intro: Lotononis haygarthii, commonly known as the Haygarth's lotonon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pale yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
